newsitem.title: OMAN: Oman bans cigarettes with over 0.6 mg nicotine.
newsitem.headline: Oman bans cigarettes with over 0.6 mg nicotine.

text.p: Oman has banned the import of cigarettes containing more than 0.6 mg of nicotine and 10 mg of tar, newspapers reported on Thursday.
The Minister of Commerce and Industry Makboul bin Ali bin Sultan announced the ban earlier in the week, but did not specify the date that it would take effect, they said.
"The decision bans the imports of cigarettes exceeding 0.6 mg of nicotine and 10 mg of tar," the Arabic-language Al-Watan daily reported.
The move is line with government efforts to discourage smoking. Last year Oman banned smoking in government offices and many public places.
The Gulf Cooperation Council -- Oman, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Qatar, United Arab Emirates -- has agreed to a phased-in rise in duties on cigarettes to 100 percent.
